title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2448/89 of 8 August 1989 determining for the Member States the estimated loss of income and the estimated level of the premium payable per ewe and per female goat for the 1989 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2448/89
of 8 August 1989
determining for the Member States the estimated loss of income and the estimated level of the premium payable per ewe and per female goat for the 1989 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
A difference is hereby found between the basic price and the foreseeable market price during the 1989 marketing year for the following regions:
(ECU/100 kg)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Difference   //    //   // 2  // 103,793   // 3   // 91,588   // 4   // 119,363   // 5  // 54,661   // 6   // 108,787   // 7   // 75,613   //    //

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per ewe and per region is as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Estimated amount of the premium payable per ewe   //    //   // 2   // 19,202   // 3  // 20,607   // 4   // 20,889   // 5   // 8,472   // 6  // 19,038   // 7   // 9,452   //    //
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (4) of Regulation (EEC) No 1837/80, the advance which the Member States are authorized to pay to sheepmeat producers located in less-favoured agricultural areas shall be as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Advance on premium payable per ewe   //    //   // 2   // 5,761   // 3   // 6,182   // 4  // 6,267   // 5   // 2,542   // 6   // 5,711   // 7   // 2,836   //    //

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per female goat and per region in the areas designated in Annex III of Regulation (EEC) No 1837/80 and in Article 1 of Regulation (EEC) No 1065/86 is as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Estimated amount of the premium payable per female goat   //    //   // 2   // 15,362   // 7  // 7,562   //    //
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (4) of Regulation (EEC) No 1837/80, the advance which the Member States are authorized to pay to goatmeat producers located in the less-favoured areas with the areas designated in paragraph 1 above shall be as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Advance on premium payable per female goat   //    //   // 2   // 4.609   // 7   // 2,269  //    //

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per female sheep other than eligible ewe and per region in the areas mentioned in the Annex to Regulation (EEC) No 872/84 is as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Estimated amount of the premium payable per female sheep other than eligible ewe   //    //  // 5   // 6,778   //    //
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (4) of Regulation (EEC) No 1837/80, the advance which the Member States are authorized to pay to producers of female sheep other than eligible ewes located in less-favoured agricultural areas within the areas mentioned in paragraph 1 above shall be as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region   // Advance on premium payable per female sheep other than eligible ewes   //    //   // 5  // 2,033   //    //

In accordance with Article 5 (4) of Regulation (EEC) No 1837/80 and by way of derogation from Article 4 (4) of Regulation (EEC) No 3007/84, Member States of region 1 are hereby authorized to pay the advance payable in region 2 to producers of sheepmeat and, in the case of the areas specified in Annex III to Regulation (EEC) No 1837/80 and Article 1 of Regulation (EEC) No 1065/86, to producers of goatmeat.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
